lead_paragraph: Facing criticism for failing to notify the public in the 2014 outbreak, state officials released emails suggesting they were thwarted by local health officials.

byline.original: By MITCH SMITH and ABBY GOODNOUGH

headline.print_headline: Michigan Officials Defend Handling of Outbreak in Flint
headline.main: Michigan Officials Defend Handling of Legionnaires’ Disease Outbreak in Flint

snippet: Facing criticism for failing to notify the public in the 2014 outbreak, state officials released emails suggesting they were thwarted by local health officials.
abstract: Federal, state and local health officials, responding to broad attacks, defend their actions in dealing with deadly 2014 Legionnaires' disease outbreak in Flint, Mich, that may have been connected to change in city's water source; state investigators have indicated that far-reaching inquiry into crisis could bring range of charges, including involuntary manslaughter and official misconduct.
